Description: Small spindle-whorl made of a dense white stone with a flat base and a slightly curved upper side. A perforation is drilled through the centre of the object from the base, getting thinner towards the upper side. In the perforation the ridges from the drill are well visible. The outside is very well smoothed on both sides. On the edge few traces of chipping.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.15D, south section, levels 1-2
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 150)
